titleStmt.title: Gods vengeance upon the rebels in Ireland being a true relation how upon the 7, day of December they slew two and twenty of the Protestant shepheards, and drove away the greatest part of their cattell. Also how upon the 8. day of December, the rebels having made themselves drunke, afterward each man slew his friend, to the number of three thousand, it being the birth-day of the great Lord Don Makertodough, chiefe rebell in Ireland. Likewise how the protestants ceazed upon their cattell, and other spoile, to the great overthrow of all the rebels in Ireland. Sent in a letter from Colonell Rouse to Sir Iohn Sampson, Knight and Baronet, Decemb. 14. 1641.
titleStmt.author: Rouse, Anthony.

Sent in a letter from Colonell Rouse to Sir Iohn Sampson, Knight and Baronet, Decemb. 14. 1641.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
